title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 159.4 - Federal changes not binding
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 159.4 - Federal changes not binding

State Regulations

Tax Law, ยง 659

The Tax Commission is not required to accept as correct
any change (as set forth in this Part) in a taxpayer's Federal taxable income, Federal items of tax preference, total taxable amount or ordinary income
portion of a lump sum distribution, Federal credit for employment-related
expenses or the disallowance (in whole or in part) of a claim for credit or
refund of Federal income tax or the amount an employer is required to deduct
and withhold from wages for Federal income tax withholding purposes. Instead, the Tax Commission may conduct an independent audit or investigation in regard
thereto. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
ยง
159.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
